text.__SUMMARY__: Gymnopilus echinulisporus is a species of agaric fungus in the family Cortinariaceae. It was first formally described by American mycologist William Alphonso Murrill in 1912.
text.Description: The convex to flattened cap is up to 7 cm (2.8 in) in diameter.
text.Habitat and distribution: Gymnopilus echinulisporus has been found growing on wood in Oregon in November.
